intro: Pergularia daemia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with indirect sunlight. Its foliage is often velvety and dark green, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Pergularia daemia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
